zakat.title: What is Zakat?
zakat.body: Zakat is obligatory charity on eligible savings/assets at 2.5%, given to eligible recipients.
zakat.description: Zakat is one of the Five Pillars of Islam and is an obligatory form of charity. It requires Muslims to donate 2.5% of their wealth annually to help those in need. It purifies wealth and ensures social justice.

fidyah.title: What is Fidyah?
fidyah.body: Fidyah is paid for each fast missed when one cannot fast and cannot make up later. Your masjid sets the per-day rate.
fidyah.description: Fidyah is compensation paid by those who cannot fast during Ramadan due to illness, pregnancy, or old age. It involves feeding one poor person for each day of missed fasting.
fidyah.rate: Rate: Cost of one meal per missed day

kaffarah.title: What is Kaffarah?
kaffarah.body: Kaffarah is compensation for certain violations like intentionally breaking a fast or oaths. Follow local masjid guidance.
kaffarah.description: Kaffarah is expiation for intentionally breaking a fast during Ramadan without a valid reason. It requires either fasting for 60 consecutive days or feeding 60 poor people.
kaffarah.rate: Rate: 60 days fasting or feeding 60 people

sadaqah.title: What is Sadaqah?
sadaqah.body: Sadaqah is voluntary charity of any amount at any time.
sadaqah.description: Sadaqah is voluntary charity given out of love for Allah and compassion for others. It can be given at any time and in any amount. Sadaqah purifies wealth, increases blessings, and helps those in need.
sadaqah.rate: Rate: Any amount you wish to give

masjid.title: What is the Masjid Fund?
masjid.body: Supports utilities, maintenance, education, and construction for Masjid Ul Huda.
masjid.description: Masjid Fund donations support the daily operations, maintenance, utilities, community programs, and other essential activities of the masjid. These contributions help maintain the house of Allah and serve the community.
masjid.rate: Rate: Any amount you wish to give
